issue.title: The resolution of LWG3465 was damaged by P2167R3

discussion.p: In the resolution of LWG , F < E was required to be well-formed and implicitly convertible to `bool`. However, replaced the convertibility requirements with just "each of `decltype(E == F)` and decltype(E < F) models `boolean-testable`", which rendered the type of F < E underconstrained.
Set status to Tentatively Ready after seven votes in favour during reflector poll.

li.blockquote:
(6.3) — Otherwise, if the expressions E == F, E < F, and F < E are all well-formed and each of `decltype(E == F)` and, decltype(E < F) , and decltype(F < E) models `boolean-testable`,
E == F ? partial_ordering::equivalent : E < F ? partial_ordering::less : F < E ? partial_ordering::greater : partial_ordering::unordered
except that `E` and `F` are evaluated only once.
